reviewText:
I purchased this game regardless of lack of reviews, so after playing through this game I feel obligated to help others make their decision.

Basically this game is exactly what you are already expecting. A point and click exploration puzzle game, there is nothing here you have not essentially seen before. The only unique factor I noticed in that this game tries very hard to create an atrmosphere through impressive visual and audio effects.

I only play this style of game occasionally so I have limited opinion regarding its actual level of difficulty. I admittedly used the hint button a few times when stuck. I found the times I went for a hint, the answer turned out to be something I would have never pieced together on my own. With that said I think some puzzles were overly difficult. At the same time the majority of the game was quick and easy. So I guess the developers aimed for a balanced average, but after the game is said and done I feel like there was no difficulty balance at all.

I finished the game in about 2 hours using hints when I was stuck and fealt I had tried everything. Admittedly those hints sped things up significantly, but I still feel like I paid for a short game with no replay value. With that said I am not happy with my decision, but no worries, I waste my money all the time.

Overall I only recommend this game to someone who really anjoys this style of game, doesn't expect anything new from this genere and can accept that the difficulty balance is ridiculous. Honestly I had some fun, but I regret making the purchase.

reviewText: I liked this game.  It was a dark, mysterious adventure; however, it was way too short and easy to solve.  I would have liked a bit more of a challenge.  The last video in the game is missing, which was a big disappointment.  I was able to end the game through Task Manager then continue by way of the game menu screen, and the final video finally showed up.  I truly don't understand why Interia would put a game on the market with such a huge bug.  Even with that, I'll recommend the game for its eerie atmosphere, nice graphics and music, and because I enjoyed the hour of winding my way through the ghostly mansion.
voteText: 5 of 5 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
I've played ten minutes, and this game has left me with mixed feelings. On one hand, it has an intriguing story so far, a GREAT sense of atmosphere and suspense, and lovely visuals.  It's also made me aware of just how badly this genre of games NEEDS to have a reactive cursor.

Which this game doesn't have.

So far I've had to hit up the hint system more than once just to find out what I could pick up, or move. It's not obvious. At all. So I reccomend this game for the mood and music, and add a note of caution - the gameplay is rough, and may be more frustrating than you like.

reviewText: great little game.some nice puzzles to get your mind working.lovely music.9/10.

Trudged through 69 mins before screen went black and was stopped in my tracks. Music carried on but nothing else. Had to use task manager to escape (from the game not the manor!).\nAs for gameplay, it was both very simple and very frustrating - no highlighted areas or indication as to what actions to take. Ended up using the hint button to figure out what to do. Some actions/items although were glaringly obvious and the one mini game was so easy it was laughable.\nOverall it was a boring, uninteresting waste of 69 mins and I wouldn't recommend this game to anyone.
This game was fun, however it took me 109 minutes to finish, and I do not consider myself to be an expert gamer.

This is quite a good game. True, it's terribly short - I didn't use any hint and was done in aprox. an hour, and for that length, it's rather expensive. It can feel a bit plain at first, maybe due to the fact that it doesn't use that fancy ornate cursor we're used from Hidden Object Games but the system cursor, and there's no talking, only sound and music (except for one situation where you have to dial a phone number). I had played previous games by this developer (not available on Steam), which were dense, athmospheric, had very good voice acting and a compelling story - and they were nice and long. Compared to them (Margrave: Curse of the severed heart" and "Margrave: The Blacksimth's daughter")

reviewText: Very nicely done. The artwork was atmospheric and full of detail. The puzzles were just right in that they were completely logical. The story was intriguing and well written. The controls and navigation were easy to use. The game did crash at one pont, but when I restored it, everything was saved where I left off and I had no further issues with it.
Game locked/froze with a black screen after leaving the church... unable to finish... nice.
